mods.note: Naval STatf' dmiralty, S.V»’.l. 22nd September, 1938. Near Cri [^Xr\ cr^ f The C-in-0 East indies Station has asked that tne surveying ship li.M.b. CiihLLENGER may survey the channel inside kASIRAH Island off the coast of OMAN. Can you say whether there is likely to be any objection to landing and marking the coast for surveying purposes. E.M.S. CHALLENGER may be available for this work in November 1938 or March 1939. r Command er,Roy al Navy. J.P. Gibson Esq., India Office, S.W.l. A

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: PZ 6598/38 'Muscat and Oman: survey of the channel inside Masirah Island off the coast of Oman'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 4; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file consists of correspondence regarding the proposed survey of the channel inside Masirah Island [Jazīrat Maşīrah] off the coast of Oman by the surveying ship HMS Challenger.Correspondents include the Admiralty Intelligence Division, and the India Office.The file includes a divider which gives a list of correspondence references contained in the file by year. This is placed at the back of the correspondence.

name.namePart: Admiralty War Staff, Naval Intelligence Division
